intro: Cyclorhiza, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive blue or purple ray florets and a central disk of yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and saline soils, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Cyclorhiza has a rosette of basal leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating, which helps reduce water loss. Its unique morphology and ecological niche make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
